Class FileLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ijg.darklight.sdk.utils.FileLoader

  • public class FileLoader
extends java.lang.Object
    Utilities for loading files, especially in tokenized form

      static java.lang.String loadFromInputStream(java.io.InputStream is)
      Load data from an InputStream and return as a String
      static byte[] removeZeroBytesAndCompact(byte[] bytes)
      Removes bytes from a byte array with an integer value of 0, and compacts the array so there are no empty slots
      static java.util.ArrayList<byte[]> tokenizedLoad(java.io.File file)
      Loads a file as tokens using a scanner, tokens are converted to byte arrays using the String.getBytes() method

      • tokenizedLoad

        public static java.util.ArrayList<byte[]> tokenizedLoad(java.io.File file)
                                                 throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Loads a file as tokens using a scanner, tokens are converted to byte arrays using the String.getBytes() method
        Parameters:
        file - The file to load
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of the loaded tokens, as byte arrays
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • loadFromInputStream

        public static java.lang.String loadFromInputStream(java.io.InputStream is)
                                            throws java.io.IOException
        Load data from an InputStream and return as a String
        Parameters:
        is - InputStream to retrieve data from
        Returns:
        The loaded data compiled into a single string
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • removeZeroBytesAndCompact

        public static byte[] removeZeroBytesAndCompact(byte[] bytes)
                                        throws java.security.InvalidParameterException
        Removes bytes from a byte array with an integer value of 0, and compacts the array so there are no empty slots
        Parameters:
        bytes - The byte array to work with
        Returns:
        The byte array without any 0's, and compacted
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidParameterException - If the byte array only contains 0's
